program_details.description: The GSIS Scholarship Program (GSP) aims to ease the burden of tuition fees and other educational expenses, enabling more students to pursue their academic dreams and contribute positively to the nationâ€™s development.

financial_coverage: Scholarship amount is up to PHP 40,000
PHP 20,000 is awarded as the tuition fee.
PHP 2000 per month is given as a stipend.

academic_requirements: The dependent must have been accepted or is currently enrolled in any year level of a four- or five-year course in a Higher Education Institution (HEI) recognized by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED).

additional_conditions: The applicant must be a dependent of an active GSIS member or pensioner.
The member or pensioner should have at least 15 years of GSIS premium contributions, with updated premium payments.
The combined annual family income of the member should not exceed PHP 500,000.

required_documents: A certification or proof of enrollment from the HEI stating that the dependent is admitted or enrolled for the current academic year.
A copy of the latest ITR of the member, or a Certification of Non-Filing of Income, whichever is applicable.
A birth certificate or any other legal document proving the relationship between the member and the dependent.
Certificate of good moral character from school.
application_process: Collect all necessary documents as per the list provided by GSIS.
Applications can be submitted either online through the GSIS website or in person at any GSIS office. Ensure all forms are duly completed and signed.
After submission, applicants will receive a confirmation of receipt. The selection process may take some time as GSIS evaluates all applications.
Successful applicants will be notified via email or phone call. They will receive further instructions on how to claim their benefits.
